concept.title: Instances
concept.shortdesc: This topic contains information to help you troubleshoot your instances.

dlentry.dt: Inaccurate IP addresses display in the output of euca-describe-addresses.

dd.p: This can occur if you add IPs from the wrong subnet into your public IP pool, do a restart on the CC, swap out the wrong ones for the right ones, and do another restart on the CC. To resolve this issue, run the following commands.
dd.note: A restart should only be performed when no instances are running, or when instance service interruption can be tolerated. A restart causes the CC to reset its networking configuration, regardless of whether or not it is in use. A restart of a CC in Managed and Managed (NoVLAN) modes that is managing active VMs can cause a temporary loss of network connectivity until the CC relearns the network topology and rebuilds the IP table entries.
dd.codeblock: systemctl stop eucalyptus-cloud.service systemctl stop eucalyptus-cc.service iptables -F systemctl restart eucalyptus-cc.service systemctl start eucalyptus-cloud.service

dlentry.dt: NC does not recalculate disk size correctly

dd.p: This can occur when trying to add extra disk space for instance ephemeral storage. To resolve this, you need to delete the instance cache and restart the NC.
